pros: Great environment, the staff were approachable
cons: Some circ workers do not tend to complete all their tasks.

pros: Location in Portland and working with the students.
cons: Promoting and continuing to support toxic managers, that continue to run off multiple employees and are incompetent. Extremely low pay for the Portland area. Stagnation, there is limited opportunity for advancement.

pros: Collaboration with students; beautiful campus; wonderful colleagues
cons: Authoritarian decision-making; avoidant communication; lack of transparency and accountability

review_title: I enjoy what they have to provide
pros: Good school, good athletics overall
cons: Nothing at this time to provide

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in McMinnville, OR
pros: The students are the best
cons: Weird decisions by admin have been made

pros: Students are great, many wonderful colleagues
cons: Very low pay and high stress

job_title: Computer Support Technician in McMinnville, OR
pros: the people and culture are great. PTO is awesome
cons: pay is not on par with work

review_title: More and more administrators and fewer faculty and staff
pros: location and staff; nice campus
cons: pay cuts and slashed retirement contributions; very low pay; lack of support from the administration; overpaid administrators

review_title: Love my work, love my co-workers
pros: Great benefits for employees with children. I took advantage of the Tuition Remission program for two of my children. Also good retirement benefits and satisfactory health benefits. Personal time off is generous; I always have time off when I need it. (If my workload allows).
cons: The workload is too much. The expectations of salaried employees is too high, at least in the department I work in. I rarely work less than a 50 hour week and during certain times of the year I work 60+ hours a week; making it difficult to balance life with work.

pros: The people are friendly and it is easy to find people to talk to to get your questions answered. There is a range of opportunities and if you have a relationship built with faculty then it is easy to find the job that is right for you.
cons: It seems like there is always something going on with payroll and it can sometimes be hard to get paid you have to check back a few times. They guarantee more students jobs then they actually have vacancies for.

pros: Excellent employee benefits. Great coworkers. Beautiful working environment. The best part of the job is watching the students you help reach their goals.
cons: It is really hard to think of something negative. Pay could be a little better, but its pretty similar to what you would find in other similar settings in the Portland area.

review_title: Worked in the facilities management team in order to manage large and small scale events on campus. Great overall place.
pros: Great group of people, good communication between lower level employees, positive working environment, great overall experience.
cons: Interaction with upper level management was not easily doable, not a clear vision for all employees to buy into and work towards.

pros: Many Community members and colleagues are dedicated to students and their education.
cons: Faculty and Staff have lost a sense of community.  There has been a lot of turnover due to administrative changes.  Technology outdated and unstable.

pros:
Students are great
Faculty are very pleasant
Hours are great
Benefits are fantastic
cons:
Worst HR department I have ever dealt with in my life. Expect to meet someone from HR your first day and never again after that moment.
Salaries are very low considering the amount of hours/effort spent.
Heads of departments are kind of clueless to what is going on in their own department.
Certain employees you cannot trust with anything.

review_title: Phonathon. Called recent alumni asking for donations.
pros: Taught me how to cold call.  Good incentives for getting donations.  Everyone is happy to work with you and help you succeed.
cons: In the beginning you get stuck calling recent alumni that have just graduated and are still paying student loans. Sometimes you end up calling people who got kicked out of the school.  Cold calling isn't always fun.

pros: They do a really great job with working with your school schedule and study conflicts if you are a student.
cons: There aren't really any cons. Sometimes the work can get a bit monotonous, but other than that it is a nice work environment.

pros: Small classes, four years to get to know your students, generally 3/3 teaching loads, faculty have a large role in governance, beautiful campus in beautiful region, about an hour from Portland
cons: Relatively low salaries but above average compensation packages (because of a good healthcare plan and a great retirement plan)

job_title: Art Teacher Assistant in McMinnville, OR
pros: I am employed at Linfield College as part of my work-study program.  I have gained invaluable experience in a wide variety of duties including filing, data entry, excel, and have met people from all over the country.
cons: As part of the workstudy agreement, I am allowed only up to ten hours of work time per week.

review_title: Great college in an idyllic setting.
job_title: Director of Prospect Research in McMinnville, OR
pros: This is a terrific school.
cons: The location of the campus is somewhat isolated. There was a very limited budget for fundraising.

pros: Linfield College has always and will always be a supportive, friendly environment where students are put first.
cons: No cons for employment with Linfield College Portland Campus

pros: The staff truly care about the wellbeing and experiences of the students/
cons: General politics can take place, some perceived tension between staff and faculty.

pros: Flexible schedules, mostly great supervisors
cons: Limited work hours, repetitive work

pros: I worked there as a student and they gave me great experience in higher ed.
cons: Only received a stipend, would have preferred hourly.

pros: Great organization to work for. Excellent benefits.
cons: Expectations can be unrealistic. Pay isn't very competitive, but work environment makes up for it.

pros: Flexible Schedule, Kind Employers, Holidays
cons: Limited Hours, Very Low Wage
